content: The Act is titled the "United States-Flag Passenger Vessel Act of 1993" and amends Section 8 of the Act of June 19, 1886 regarding coastwise transportation of passengers. The "United States-Flag Passenger Vessel Act of 1993" amends regulations for coastwise transportation of passengers, requiring vessels to meet specific criteria and documentation. Violators face civil penalties and potential seizure of the vessel. The "United States-Flag Passenger Vessel Act of 1993" amends regulations for coastwise transportation of passengers, with penalties for violators. Definitions in the act include coastwise trade and exclusion of travel agents on promotional voyages. The "United States-Flag Passenger Vessel Act of 1993" allows ineligible vessels to transport passengers in coastwise trade on specific trade routes if they met certain criteria before March 9, 1993, and file an affidavit with the Secretary of Transportation within one year of the Act's enactment. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels like Emerald Princess, Europa Star, and Europa Sun for employment in coastwise trade. Additionally, a certificate may be issued for M/V Helton Voyager for coastwise trade if certain conditions are met. The vessel M/V Helton Voyager may be issued a certificate of documentation for coastwise trade under specific conditions, including a major conversion in a US shipyard before January 1, 1994, with costs exceeding the vessel's pre-conversion value. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with appropriate endorsement for the vessel M/V Twin Drill (Panama official number 8536-PEXT-2) if the vessel undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard costing more than 3 times the purchase value, completed and documented with a coastwise endorsement before June 30, 1995. Additionally, the person documenting the vessel must contract with a US shipyard to construct another vessel of equal or greater passenger capacity within 12 months of the enactment of this Act, for delivery within 36 months. The vessel Star of Texas (Lloyds register number L5103936) may engage in coastwise trade out of the Port of Galveston for 5 years if certain conditions are met, including having at least 60 employees who are US citizens proficient in safety training certified by the US Coast Guard.
